selected_quotes: #Tomosíntesis reduce el rellamado para más estudios por falsos positivos: [Lancet Oncol. 2013] - PubMed
Lancet Oncology publicado el 25/4/2013 estudio STORM sobre tomosíntesis en pesquisa mamográfica.
3D breast screens improve detection and reduce false positives-- new in @TheLancet Oncology
#Oncology: Integrated 2D 3D mammography improves breast-cancer detection, could reduce false positive recall

citation.abstract: Digital breast tomosynthesis with 3D images might overcome some of the limitations of conventional 2D mammography for detection of breast cancer. We investigated the effect of integrated 2D and 3D mammography in population breast-cancer screening.
citation.title: Integration of 3D digital mammography with tomosynthesis for population breast-cancer screening (STORM): a prospective comparison study

news.title: 3D Breast Screenings Make Detection Easier & Decrease False Positives
news.summary: 3D mammograms could provide significant improvements in cancer detection and decreasing false positives when used in collaboration regular 2D mammograms, according to a new study by a team of Italian and Australian researchers. The finding, published in Th

news.title: Combined 3D and 2D Mammography More Sensitive in Detecting Breast Cancer
news.summary: Mammography is a common procedure used to screen women for breast cancer. 3D mammography combined with 2D mammography or synthetic 2D mammography can detect more cases of breast cancer as compared to 2D mammography alone.

source.name: National Academies Press
source.description: The US National Academies Press (NAP) was created by the National Academy of Sciences to publish the reports of the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine, operating under a charter granted by the Congress of the United States. The NAP publishes on a wide range of topics in science, engineering, and medicine, providing authoritative information on important matters in science and health policy.
